data.title: AudioEngine on Android 7.0 locks up UI and causes severe time delay before playback starts
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on: Nexus 5X, Nexus 9, Nexus 6P
- developing environments
  - NDK version: r10e

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Play an MP3 audio file using AudioEngine::play2d("file.mp3") on Android 6.0, 5.0, 4.4, 4.0 and notice how there is very little lag without preloading the audio file.
2. Update phone to Android 7.0 (Nexus 5X, Nexus 9, Pixel C, and Nexus 6P have supported images at the time)
3. Play an MP3 audio file using AudioEngine::play2d("file.mp3") also without preloading
4. Notice the long delay in starting playback of the audio file and how the entire UI is locked up. We've seen cases where calling "AudioEngine::play2d("file.mp3")" on a 500k MP3 file causes a 2-3 second lock up of the UI. The exact same device running Android 6.0 or below and playing the exact same audio file using the same AudioEngine code has no noticeable playback lag and does not appear to lock up the UI for a noticeable amount of time.

We've been able to reproduce this behavior on Nexus 5X, Nexus 9 (wifi), and Nexus 6P running a before and after test with Cocos2D-X 3.13.1, Android 6.0 (plays fine) and on Android 7.0.

data.title: cocos command line tools allows to create project with package containing '-' character
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1

cocos allows to create project with package containing invalid character.
example: cocos new TestProj -l cpp -p com.test-site.game

Here, com.test-site.game is an invalid package identifier. 
This will result in build error because of invalid character in AndroidManifest.xml

data.title: Move skipBOM function outside to prevent shadowing warning
data.body:
I'm getting the following warning message when compiling libluacocos2d with Xcode 8.0:

```
cocos/scripting/lua-bindings/manual/CCLuaStack.cpp:851:36: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]

    auto skipBOM = [](const char*& chunk, int& chunkSize){
                  ^

cocos/scripting/lua-bindings/manual/CCLuaStack.cpp:851:48: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]

    auto skipBOM = [](const char*& chunk, int& chunkSize){
                                                      ^
```

This patch moves `skipBOM` function definition outside of `luaLoadBuffer` function to prevent those warnings.
Thanks!

data.title: [js-bindings] unconfirmed undefined behavior
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: v3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. On line number [792](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/scripting/js-bindings/manual/ScriptingCore.cpp#L792) & [800](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/scripting/js-bindings/manual/ScriptingCore.cpp#L800) of [ScriptingCore.cpp](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/scripting/js-bindings/manual/ScriptingCore.cpp) the memory pointed to by `second` may be deleted twice. After calling `delete it->second;` the first time, if (by any chance), `delete it->second;` is called again, it's undefined behavior.
2. Can somebody else confirm or rebut it? 
3. If this is confirmed, the patch may be to set `it->second= NULL;` after the first `delete`.

data.title: JniHelper no long thread safe.
data.body:
In Cocos 3.11 JniHelper was modified to clean up local references to converted strings automatically, this however has made JniHelper no longer threadsafe. I know that most of Cocos2dx isn't thread safe, but as JniHelper is a platform interop class it would be more useful if it itself was.

The static localRefs variable which is a member of JniHelper (https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/platform/android/jni/JniHelper.h#L244) can be accessed and modified by multiple threads calling into JniHelper code at the same time.

Access to the localRefs variable should be guarded by a mutex and the vectors for jobjects should probably be segmented by the current thread's id so as to prevent simultaneous accessing of jobject vectors.

data.title: Fix -Wpessimizing-move warning when using Xcode 8
data.body:
This PR removes a superfluous `std::move` causing the following warning when building with `-Wpessimizing-move` compiler option on Xcode 8.0 (probably it can be reproduced on Xcode 7.3+):

```
cocos/editor-support/cocostudio/CCDataReaderHelper.cpp:150:13: warning: moving a temporary object prevents copy elision [-Wpessimizing-move]
        s = std::move(fs->getStringFromFile(filename));
            ^
cocos/editor-support/cocostudio/CCDataReaderHelper.cpp:150:13: note: remove std::move call here
        s = std::move(fs->getStringFromFile(filename));
            ^~~~~~~~~~                               ~
```

data.title: [DON'T MERGE] Initial update so that Sprites work as before (with one exception)
data.body:
There's an issue still when you change texture from ETC1Alpha to another texture type.

The fundamental issue I see with the PR [16118](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/16118)  is that ETC1 is treated as a normal use case when I think that it should almost have its own SpriteETC1Alpha class derived from Sprite overriding a couple of the methods.

However, people probably would like to be able to create a sprite and then set it's texture to some texture type (e.g. ETC1Alpha) and then later change it to a different texture type and vice versa.

This PR will attempt to find the best way to support that as well as allow for setting custom shader commands. If this is not straightforward then documentation may be necessary to note that if one wants to change a Sprite from one texture type to another may be required to update the GLProgramState manually after every setTexture call.

And also I get the same warning when compiling for Mac:

```
cocos/ui/UIEditBox/Mac/CCUIEditBoxMac.mm:295:52: warning: semicolon before method body is ignored [-Wsemicolon-before-method-body]
```

This gets rid of unneeded semicolons before Objective-C method bodies. Thanks.

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
Remove unnecessary inline keywords
data.body:
This pull request removes unnecessary `inline` keywords from member functions defined inside a class definition for the following reasons:
- In C++, any function defined inside the body of a class definition becomes implicitly inline function without `inline` keyword. (For more information, please see this FAQ entry: https://isocpp.org/wiki/faq/inline-functions#inline-member-fns-more.)
- It makes no difference whether you put explicit `inline` or not. [MSDN](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bw1hbe6y.aspx) says: _"In the class declaration, the functions were declared without the inline keyword. The inline keyword can be specified in the class declaration; **the result is the same.**"_
- According to [LLVM Coding Standards](http://llvm.org/docs/CodingStandards.html#don-t-use-inline-when-defining-a-function-in-a-class-definition), LLVM does not recommend the use of `inline` keyword when defining a function in a class definition.

So we can get rid of some `inline` keywords. This will simplify the code for better readability and also keeps backward compatibility.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

data.title: Fix mismatched memory deallocator
data.body:
When the allocated data for a Tiled map gets deallocated, valgrind reports the following error:

```
==23578== Mismatched free() / delete / delete []
==23578==    at 0x4C2B696: operator delete[](void*) (in /usr/lib/valgrind/vgpreload_memcheck-amd64-linux.so)
==23578==    by 0xB4CCC8: cocos2d::TMXLayer::~TMXLayer() (CCTMXLayer.cpp:148)
...
```

Upon further inspection, the allocated memory which `_tiles` points to gets allocated on [CCTMXXMLParser.cpp:457](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/2d/CCTMXXMLParser.cpp#L457) using `malloc`, therefore a `free` must be used instead of `delete []`. Otherwise we might get undefined behavior on some devices.
